question: What element defines contact information of a document or article?
When creating a form that will hold sensitive and secure data, what attribute would you add to prevent the form's <input> elements from auto populating?

What steps would you take to modify the following HTML into a details/summary section?

<div>

  <p>I have keys but no doors. I have space but no room. You can enter but can't leave. What am I?</p>

  A keyboard.

</div>

Consider the following HTML:

<div>

  <p>

    <missing tag>Painting One</missing tag>

    by Painter One. Painted in 1893.

  </p>

</div>

Which tag would you use to add the title of a work?

Consider the following HTML:

<p>Sign in to your account:</p>

<div>

  <label for="userId">User ID</label>

  <input type="text" id="userId" name="userId">

</div>

<input type="picture" id="image" alt="Login"

       src="/media/examples/login-button.png">

When the page is rendered the login input does not display the login-button.png. What must you change to correct this problem?
correct_answer: Change the input type from type="picture" to type="image"
incorrect_answers: Change the input type from type="picture" to type="png"
Change the input type from type="picture" to type="img"
Change the input type from type="picture" to type="graphic"

question: What global attribute specifies that an element can be moved on the page using the mouse?
For radio buttons to work as a group, which attribute must have the same value?

Based on the following HTML:

<video controls="controls" >

  Your browser does not support the HTML5 Video element.

</video>

How do you correctly set the source of the video?
correct_answer: By setting the src attribute value in the <video> element
incorrect_answers: By including the <embed> tag with the src attribute within the <video> element
By including the <media> tag with the src attribute within the <video> element
By setting the url attribute value in the <video> element

question:
Which HTML segments would you add below to provide alternate text if the browser doesn't support code?

<script>

document.write("Hello World!")

</script>

--INSERT HTML HERE--
Which HTML segment correctly organizes content using one of the HTML5 semantic elements?
correct_answer:
<h1>How to Fish</h1>

<section>

  <h2>Introduction</h2>

  <p>People fish for food…</p>

</section>

<section>

  <h2>Equipment</h2>

  <p>The first thing you’ll need is a fishing rod…</p>

</section>
incorrect_answers:
<h1>How to Fish</h1>

<div>

  <h2>Introduction</h2>

  <p>People fish for food…</p>

</div>

<div>

  <h2>Equipment</h2>

  <p>The first thing you’ll need is a fishing rod…</p>

</div>

<h1>How to Fish</h1>

<aside>

  <h2>Introduction</h2>

  <p>People fish for food…</p>

</aside>

<aside>

  <h2>Equipment</h2>

  <p>The first thing you’ll need is a fishing rod…</p>

</aside>

<h1>How to Fish</h1>

<article>

  <h2>Introduction</h2>

  <p>People fish for food…</p>

</article>

<article>

  <h2>Equipment</h2>

  <p>The first thing you’ll need is a fishing rod…</p>

</article>

question: Which element would you use in the <HEAD> to set the document character encoding to Unicode Transformation Format (UTF)-8?
Which is an example of a properly formed <area> tag that navigates to a URL when clicked?
Which HTML table header section is an example of formatting an entire row as a header row in a table?
What is the definition of the <blockquote> tag?
correct_answer: <blockquote> defines a section of text that is quoted from another source.
incorrect_answers: <blockquote> adds 15px of padding around the inner text.
<blockquote> adds quotation marks and italicizes the inner text
<blockquote> adds quotation marks around the inner text.

question: Which is the correct element for adding a basic telephone input to an HTML5 form?
Which is a characteristic of the <legend> element?
correct_answer: The <legend> element defines a caption for the <fieldset> element
incorrect_answers: The <legend> element defines footnotes of the associated <form> element
The <legend> element defines the properties of the <map> element
The <legend> element defines the area of the <map> element

question:
The following HTML adds a video to a web page:

<video controls="controls">

  <source src="shuttle.mp4" type="video/mp4">

  <track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English">

  </source>

  Your browser does not support the HTML5 Video element.

</video>

When the page loads, the track does not work as expected. What must you change to get it working?
correct_answer:
<track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English"> doesn't belong within the <source> tag.

Change it to:

<video controls="controls">

  <source src="shuttle.mp4" type="video/mp4">

  <track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English">

  Your browser does not support the HTML5 Video element.

</video>
incorrect_answers:
Replace

<track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English">

with

<language src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English">.

Replace

<track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English">

with

<subtitle src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English">.
Replace label="English" with language="English" and reload the page.

question: What is the difference between the <picture> and <img> tags?
correct_answer: <picture> defines a container for multiple image sources whereas <img> represents a single image.
incorrect_answers: <picture> defines a lined image whereas <img> represents an embedded image.
<picture> represents a single image that cannot be copied or downloaded whereas <img> represents a single image that can be copied and downloaded.
<picture> represents a video whereas <img> represents a single image.

question: Which tag embeds an external application, typically multimedia content such as audio or video, into an HTML document?

Consider the following markup:

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>

  <body>

    Do not forget to buy <span style="background:yellow;" >milk</span>

  </body>

</html>

What tag is available with HTML5 that, when used in place of<span style="background:yellow">, results in the same formatting?

You may (and should) display a message inside the <canvas> block for both older browsers that don't support canvas and in browsers with JavaScript disabled. Which HTML segment can you add to provide this message?

<canvas width="300" height="300">

  --INSERT HERE--

</canvas>
correct_answer: <p>Error: This is either not supported or JavaScript is disabled.</p>
incorrect_answers: <big>Error: This is either not supported or JavaScript is disabled.</big>
<error>Error: This is either not supported or JavaScript is disabled.</error>
<alt>Error: This is either not supported or JavaScript is disabled.</alt>

question:
You must review the following web page and suggest ways that could increase organic search rankings. What could you suggest to enhance search engine ranking?

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>

<body>

<h2>Heading</h2>

<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

</p>

</body>

</html>
Which element's positioning is independent of the main flow of an HTML5 document?
What level of element is the <footer>?

You want to format line 1 to be like line 2. Which tag would you use?

line 1:

My goal: Live in harmony with nature.

line 2:

My goal: "Live in harmony with nature"

The following <iframe> element was properly formatted to display a web page named hello.html. When the browser doesn't support frames nothing is displayed. What should you add within the following <iframe> element to provide information when it isn't supported?

<iframe src="hello.html" width="400" height="300" scrolling="auto">

</iframe>
correct_answer: Include text within the <iframe> element to be displayed if frames are not supported.
incorrect_answers: Add the alttext attribute with text containing a message that frames are not supported.
Add an alternate src attribute to the <iframe> tag to forward navigation if frames aren't supported.

question:
Email input is required in the following form, but a user can submit without completing the field. How can you fix this error?

<form action="/action_page.php" novalidate >

  <label for="email">Enter your email:</label>

  <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required><br><br>

  <input type="submit">

</form>
correct_answer: Remove the novalidate attribute from the <form> element.
incorrect_answers: Change the email <input> required attribute to validate.
Change the email <input> required attribute to require.

question: Which tag is classified as a formatting tag?
How would you change the default value of a <form> method attribute?
An HTML programmer must create a function that will stop the web worker named wWork from listening to messages and that will reuse the stopped web worker again when necessary. How will they do it?

Review the following HTML:

<form>

  <input type="radio" id="male" name="male" value="male">

  <label for="male">Male</label><br>

  <input type="radio" id="female" name="female" value="female">

  <label for="female">Female</label><br>

  <input type="radio" id="other" name="other" value="other">

  <label for="other">Other</label>

</form>

When one option is selected from the option group, the other options do not clear. What is the problem?
correct_answer: The name value in a radio input must be the same for all of the radio inputs in the group.
incorrect_answers: The radio input elements must be enclosed in a <group></group> tag.
The radio input type value must be type="radiogroup" and not "radio".
The ID value in a radio input must be the same for all the radio inputs in the group.

question: Why would you use the web worker in your web application?
correct_answer: To execute the long scripts in the background
incorrect_answers: To increase the performance speed of the application
To have easy direct access to the web page and the Document Object Model (DOM) API
